rules.natural: Should the restaurant receive a loan from the bank, then the restaurant is not profitable.
The restaurant is popular with celebrities, or it serves meat dishes, or it serves vegetable dishes.

Whenever the restaurant has organic certification, if it is not the case that being featured in a food show implies the restaurant is not popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.
The restaurant has organic certification or uses local produce.

Under the condition that the restaurant uses local produce, if it is not true that being featured in a food show leads to the restaurant not being popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.
If the restaurant serves meat dishes, then either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.
Whenever the restaurant serves vegetable dishes, either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.
If the restaurant has a head chef, then the menu is creative.
Under the condition that the menu is creative, the restaurant serves meat dishes or vegetable dishes.
Should the food critic own the restaurant, then the meat company supplies the restaurant.
Either the food critic owns the restaurant or the restaurant manager manages the restaurant.
Whenever the restaurant receives investment from an investor group, the restaurant is not profitable.
The restaurant receives investment from an investor group or receives a loan from the bank.
Provided that it is not the case that the restaurant manager managing the restaurant leads to the restaurant operating smoothly, the restaurant is profitable.

The restaurant does not get a Michelin star.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.

(A10 → ¬A8).natural: Should the restaurant receive a loan from the bank, then the restaurant is not profitable.

(A11 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: The restaurant is popular with celebrities, or it serves meat dishes, or it serves vegetable dishes.

(A12 → ¬A11).natural: Provided that the restaurant is featured in a food show, the restaurant is not popular with celebrities.

(A14 → (¬(A12 → ¬A11) → A13)).natural: Whenever the restaurant has organic certification, if it is not the case that being featured in a food show implies the restaurant is not popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: The restaurant has organic certification or uses local produce.

(A15 → (¬(A12 → ¬A11) → A13)).natural: Under the condition that the restaurant uses local produce, if it is not true that being featured in a food show leads to the restaurant not being popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.

(A2 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: If the restaurant serves meat dishes, then either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: The restaurant serves meat dishes or serves vegetable dishes.

(A3 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: Whenever the restaurant serves vegetable dishes, either the meat company supplies the restaurant or the restaurant operates smoothly.

(A4 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Provided that the restaurant has a head chef, the restaurant serves meat dishes or vegetable dishes.

(A4 → A5).natural: If the restaurant has a head chef, then the menu is creative.

(A5 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Under the condition that the menu is creative, the restaurant serves meat dishes or vegetable dishes.

(A6 → A1).natural: Should the food critic own the restaurant, then the meat company supplies the restaurant.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Either the food critic owns the restaurant or the restaurant manager manages the restaurant.

(A7 → G).natural: If the restaurant manager manages the restaurant, then the restaurant operates smoothly.

(A9 → ¬A8).natural: Whenever the restaurant receives investment from an investor group, the restaurant is not profitable.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: The restaurant receives investment from an investor group or receives a loan from the bank.

(¬(A12 → ¬A11) → A13).natural: If it is not true that being featured in a food show implies the restaurant is not popular with celebrities, then the restaurant gets a Michelin star.

(¬(A7 → G) → A8).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the restaurant manager managing the restaurant leads to the restaurant operating smoothly, the restaurant is profitable.
